wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant Colonel Alfred Daniel Wintle MC, better known as A. D. Wintle, (30 September 1897 – 11 May 1966) was a British military officer in the 1st The Royal Dragoons who served in the First and Second World Wars. He was the first non-lawyer to achieve a unanimous verdict in his favour in the House of Lords, and is considered one of London's greatest eccentrics.

response: *1897 – Alfred Wintle, Russian-English soldier and politician (d. 1966)
* May 11 – Alfred Wintle, British army officer and eccentric (b. 1897)
* September 30 – Alfred Wintle, British army officer, eccentric (d. 1966)
* Alfred Wintle, British army officer and eccentric (b. 1897)

link_mentions.page: Jim Broadbent on screen and stage
response: Broadbent's roles are varied from his roles as Malcom "Santa" Claus in Arthur Christmas and Horace Slughorn in Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince and Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2 to his roles as King William IV in The Young Victoria and Col. Alfred Wintle in The Last Englishman.
